config_element.name: StubInt
config_element.label: Dummy integer MIB entry
config_element.description_user: A MIB integer entry that can be harmlessly read or written, e.g., for testing.

config_element.name: StubStr
config_element.label: Dummy string MIB entry
config_element.description_user: A MIB string entry that can be harmlessly read or written, e.g., for testing.

config_element.name: FirmwareBuildNumber
config_element.label: Numeric firmware build identifier
config_element.description_user:
Each published firmware build has a unique numeric identifier and a unique textual (string) identifier. The number and the string both uniquely identify the firmware build.
This variable gives the numeric build identifier. The value should normally be expressed in decimal.
The corresponding textual identifier is available via FirmwareBuildString.

config_element.name: FirmwareBuildString
config_element.label: Textual firmware build identifier
config_element.description_user:
Each published firmware build has a unique numeric identifier and a unique textual (string) identifier. The number and the string both uniquely identify the firmware build.
This variable gives the textual build identifier. The value is an ASCII string.
The corresponding numeric identifier is available via FirmwareBuildNumber.

config_element.name: PanicOnFault
config_element.label: Halt the system on any fault
config_element.description_user:
When the chip's firmware detects a problem that implies that it cannot continue operation (such as running out of pool memory) it normally calls panic(). This halts the firmware, and may reboot it. By contrast, when the chip's firmware encounters a problem that it can survive (such as detecting a received corrupt packet) it normally calls fault(), which can cause a message, a "fault report", to be created.
If this MIB entry is set TRUE then the firmware calls panic() when it would normally call fault().
See PanicOnFaultCode, which can alter the behaviour of PanicOnFault.

config_element.name: PanicOnFaultCode
config_element.label: Halt the system on a specific fault
config_element.description_user:
The description of PanicOnFault presumes the value of PanicOnFaultCode is zero (the equivalent of "fault_none" within the firmware).
If PanicOnFaultCode is non-zero (i.e., if it is set to a valid faultid), then a call to fault() leads directly to a call to panic() only when fault() is called with the specified fault code. In other words, this key causes a PanicOnFault to occur when a specific fault occurs.

config_element.name: PcmMasterClockRate
config_element.label: First PCM interface override for clock rate
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the first digital interface in PCM mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate, bits per sample and slots per frame.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: PcmMasterMode
config_element.label: Enable master mode on first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the first PCM instance.

config_element.name: PcmShortSyncEnable
config_element.label: Enable short synchronisation for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user:
Setting this key enables Short frame sync (sync pulse width of 1 bit clock cycle, falling edge indicates start of frame) on the first PCM instance.
If long frame sync is selected the frame starts at rising edge of the sync pulse and Sync pulse width depends on PcmLongLengthSyncEnable configuration

config_element.name: PcmSignExtendEnable
config_element.label: Enable sign extend for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user:
Enable sign extension of 13/8-bit samples to 16-bit samples on the first PCM interface.
If the key is not set, the samples are padded to 16-bits by inserting extra LSBs. For 13-bit samples, the 3-bit padding can be selected by setting PcmAudioGain accordingly. 8-bit samples are padded with zeros.

config_element.name: PcmLsbFirstEnable
config_element.label: Enable LSB first for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key controls the order in which samples are transmitted and received on the first PCM interface. Set this key to send/receive LSB first.

config_element.name: PcmTxTristateEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: 0: drive PCM_OUT continuously. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in the last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is not active.

config_element.name: PcmTxTristateRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate rising edge for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only effective if PcmTxTristateEnable is set 0: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is also not active. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT after rising edge of PCM_CLK after the last data bit of an active slot.

config_element.name: PcmSyncSuppressEnable
config_element.label: Suppress frame synchronisation for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Suppress PCM_SYNC on the first PCM instance while generating PCM_CLK (in master mode). Some codecs (connected to the PCM interface) use this to enter a low power state.

config_element.name: PcmGciModeEnable
config_element.label: Enable GCI mode for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Enable PCM GCI mode.

config_element.name: PcmMuteEnable
config_element.label: Mute PCM_DATA output for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Force PCM_DATA output on first PCM instance to be muted.

config_element.name: PcmLongLengthSyncEnable
config_element.label: Enable long length sync for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: If PcmShortSyncEnable is not set, this key will configure PCM_SYNC pulse on first PCM instance to be 16 (long) or 8 (short) PCM_CLK cycles.

config_element.name: PcmSampleRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Sample PCM_DATA on rising edge of PCM_CLK for first PCM instance

config_element.name: PcmSampleFormat
config_element.label: Sample format for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only provided for backward compatibility. Use PcmSampleSize to configure up to 24 bit format. If PcmSampleSize is set, this key is ignored. This key supports formats up to 16 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration.

config_element.name: PcmSlotCount
config_element.label: Number of slots in a PCM frame for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the number of PCM slots (1-4) that are to be present between sync pulses on the first digital interface. If the key PcmMasterClockRate is set, this key is ignored as a request has been made for a specific master clock frequency.

config_element.name: PcmSyncRate
config_element.label: The PCM_SYNC rate for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the first digital interface when operating as a master in PCM mode.

config_element.name: PcmAudioGain
config_element.label: Sample gain value for first PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Some Codecs allow their gain to be controlled by 3 extra bits received at the end of a 13-bit PCM sample. This key allows the value of those 3 bits to be specified for the first PCM instance.

config_element.name: I2sSyncRate
config_element.label: Synchronisation rate in hertz for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the first digital interface when operating as a master in I2S mode.

config_element.name: I2sMasterClockRate
config_element.label: Master clock rate in hertz for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the first digital interface in I2S mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate and bits per sample.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: I2sMasterMode
config_element.label: Enable master mode on first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the first I2S instance.

config_element.name: I2sJstfyFormat
config_element.label: Set sample justification for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: left justified, 1: right justified.

config_element.name: I2sLftJstfyDly
config_element.label: Set delay before sampling when left justified for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: MSB of sample data occurs in the first bit clock period after sync transition. 1: MSB of sample data occurs in the second bit clock period after sync transition.

config_element.name: I2sChnlPlrty
config_element.label: I2S channel polarity for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: Sample data is left channel when sync clock line is high 1: Sample data is right channel when sync clock line is high

config_element.name: I2sAudioAttenEnable
config_element.label: Enable attenuation on input data for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
Enables/disables the attenuation applied to incoming (into device) audio samples in case the I2sBitsPerSample is set to 20 or 24 bits per sample on the first I2S instance.
false: 17 bit sample data is rounded down to 16 bits. true : the audio attenuation defined in the MIB key I2sAudioAtten is applied over 24 bits with saturated rounding.
Requires I2sCropEnable to be 0.

config_element.name: I2sAudioAtten
config_element.label: Attenuation in 6 dB steps for first I2S instance

config_element.name: I2sBitsPerSample
config_element.label: Bits per sample for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
This key specifies the number of bit clocks reserved for each (mono) sample on the first I2S interface. Valid settings are 16, 20, or 24 bits per sample.
This key does not specify how many of those bits are used for internal data processing; see I2sSampleSize for that. If this key is set to a value larger than I2sSampleSize, the additional bits are output as zeroes in the least significant bits. On the input, if sample size is 16 bits and bits-per-sample is greater, an attenuation can be applied, or samples larger than 16bit can be cropped to 16bits.
This key is also used to calculate the bit clock rate when in master mode and the I2sMasterClockRate key is not set. (I2sMasterClockRate takes precedence over this key for the purposes of supplying the master clock rate.) The calculation is bits per sample * 2 (channels) * sample rate.

config_element.name: I2sCropEnable
config_element.label: Takes first 16bits after sync edge as sample for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
In this mode the most significant bits after sync are taken to be the sample data. If I2sBitsPerSample is configured for 24/32 bits per sample, but I2sSampleSize is configured for 16 bits per sample only, then crop enable decides whether the I2S interface rounds or truncates incoming 24/32 bits to 16 bits.
Additionally, it must be enabled if in 16 bit per sample mode when CLK rate = 32*sample rate.
0: Disable Cropping(or select rounding) 1: Enable Cropping
From CSRA681xx, the crop mode is selected automatically, and there is no need to set this key; it should be left at its default value.

config_element.name: I2sTxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when TX begins for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S transmission begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S transmission begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2sRxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when RX begins for first I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S reception begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S reception begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: AudioIfsReturnToDefaultOnClose
config_element.label: Return audio interfaces to default configuration when closed
config_element.description_user: Setting this key will cause the audio interfaces to be returned to the MIB defaults when all users of an interface have closed the endpoints. For example the PCM MIB defaults will be applied when all slots have been released. For Codecs and other endpoints that don't share a physical interface (like the PCM bus) then the defaults will be set when the endpoints are released.

config_element.name: PcmPioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for first PCM/I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines which chip pins the first PCM or I2S interface (instance 0) comes out on. (The same pins are shared by these two interfaces, so they cannot be used simultaneously.) The octet string key value contains a value each for the PCM signal lines CLK, SYNC, MCLK, DOUT & DIN (or, for I2S: SCK, WS, MCLK, SD_OUT, & SD_IN). Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or 0xFE: Dedicated pin as per chip pinout If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused Note that signals cannot be a combination of PIO and dedicated pins.

config_element.name: Pcm1PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for second PCM/I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines which chip pins the second PCM or I2S interface (instance 1) comes out on. (The same pins are shared by these two interfaces, so they cannot be used simultaneously.) The octet string key value contains a value each for the PCM signal lines CLK, SYNC, MCLK, DOUT & DIN (or, for I2S: SCK, WS, MCLK, SD_OUT, & SD_IN). Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or 0xFE: Dedicated pin as per chip pinout If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused Note that signals cannot be a combination of PIO and dedicated pins.

config_element.name: Pcm2PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for third PCM/I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines which chip pins the third PCM or I2S interface (instance 2) comes out on. (The same pins are shared by these two interfaces, so they cannot be used simultaneously.) The octet string key value contains a value each for the PCM signal lines CLK, SYNC, MCLK, DOUT & DIN (or, for I2S: SCK, WS, MCLK, SD_OUT, & SD_IN). Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or 0xFE: Dedicated pin as per chip pinout If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused Note that signals cannot be a combination of PIO and dedicated pins.

config_element.name: Pcm3PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for fourth PCM/I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines which chip pins the fourth PCM or I2S interface (instance 3) comes out on. (The same pins are shared by these two interfaces, so they cannot be used simultaneously.) On some devices the fourth PCM or I2S instance could support multi-lane enhanced I2S interface with additional 3 DIN lines. So unlike other PCM or I2S instances, the fourth instance octet string key value contains a value each for the PCM signal lines CLK, SYNC, MCLK, DOUT & DIN (or, for I2S: SCK, WS, MCLK, SD_OUT, & SD_IN) as well as 3 additional DIN lines DIN_B, DIN_C & DIN_D (or, for I2S: SD_IN_B, SD_IN_C & SD_IN_D). Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or 0xFE: Dedicated pin as per chip pinout If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused Note that signals cannot be a combination of PIO and dedicated pins.
config_element.default: [FE FE FF FE FE FF FF FF]

config_element.name: Spdif0InPioConfig
config_element.label: Input PIO configuration for first SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how input pin for first SPDIF instance (instance 0) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif1InPioConfig
config_element.label: Input PIO configuration for second SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how input pin for second SPDIF instance (instance 1) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif2InPioConfig
config_element.label: Input PIO configuration for third SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how input pin for third SPDIF instance (instance 2) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif3InPioConfig
config_element.label: Input PIO configuration for fourth SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how input pin for fourth SPDIF instance (instance 3) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: CoreEnable
config_element.label: List of processor instances to be enabled
config_element.description_user: This key lists the processor instance numbers other than processor 0 to be activated. By default all supported processors are active. For dual-core, only processor 1 is listed here.

config_element.name: Pcm1MasterClockRate
config_element.label: Second PCM interface override for clock rate
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the second digital interface in PCM mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate, bits per sample and slots per frame.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: Pcm1MasterMode
config_element.label: Enable master mode for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the second PCM instance.

config_element.name: Pcm1ShortSyncEnable
config_element.label: Enable short synchronisation for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user:
Setting this key enables Short frame sync (sync pulse width of 1 bit clock cycle, falling edge indicates start of frame) on the second PCM instance.
If long frame sync is selected the frame starts at rising edge of the sync pulse and Sync pulse width depends on Pcm1LongLengthSyncEnable configuration

config_element.name: Pcm1SignExtendEnable
config_element.label: Enable sign extend for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user:
Enable sign extension of 13/8-bit samples to 16-bit samples on the second PCM interface.
If the key is not set, the samples are padded to 16-bits by inserting extra LSBs. For 13-bit samples, the 3-bit padding can be selected by setting Pcm1AudioGain accordingly. 8-bit samples are padded with zeros.

config_element.name: Pcm1LsbFirstEnable
config_element.label: Enable LSB first for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key controls the order in which samples are transmitted and received on the second PCM interface. Set this key to send/receive LSB first.

config_element.name: Pcm1TxTristateEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: 0: drive PCM_OUT continuously. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in the last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is not active.

config_element.name: Pcm1TxTristateRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate rising edge for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only effective if Pcm1TxTristateEnable is set 0: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is also not active. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT after rising edge of PCM_CLK after the last data bit of an active slot.

config_element.name: Pcm1SyncSuppressEnable
config_element.label: Suppress frame synchronisation for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Suppress PCM_SYNC on the second PCM instance while generating PCM_CLK (in master mode). Some codecs (connected to the PCM interface) use this to enter a low power state.

config_element.name: Pcm1GciModeEnable
config_element.label: Enable GCI mode for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Enable PCM GCI mode.

config_element.name: Pcm1MuteEnable
config_element.label: Mute PCM_DATA output for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Force PCM_DATA output on second PCM instance to be muted.

config_element.name: Pcm1LongLengthSyncEnable
config_element.label: Enable long length sync for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: If Pcm1ShortSyncEnable is not set, this key will configure PCM_SYNC pulse on second PCM instance to be 16 (long) or 8 (short) PCM_CLK cycles.

config_element.name: Pcm1SampleRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Sample PCM_DATA on rising edge of PCM_CLK for second PCM instance

config_element.name: Pcm1SampleFormat
config_element.label: Sample format for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only provided for backward compatibility. Use Pcm1SampleSize to configure up to 24 bit format. If Pcm1SampleSize is set, this key is ignored. This key supports formats up to 16 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration.

config_element.name: Pcm1SlotCount
config_element.label: Number of slots in a PCM frame for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the number of PCM slots (1-4) that are to be present between sync pulses on the second digital interface. If the key Pcm1MasterClockRate is set, this key is ignored as a request has been made for a specific master clock frequency.

config_element.name: Pcm1SyncRate
config_element.label: The PCM_SYNC rate for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the second digital interface when operating as a master in PCM mode.

config_element.name: Pcm1AudioGain
config_element.label: Sample gain value for second PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Some Codecs allow their gain to be controlled by 3 extra bits received at the end of a 13-bit PCM sample. This key allows the value of those 3 bits to be specified for the second PCM instance.

config_element.name: Pcm2MasterClockRate
config_element.label: Third PCM interface override for clock rate
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the third digital interface in PCM mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate, bits per sample and slots per frame.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: Pcm2MasterMode
config_element.label: Enable PCM master mode for third PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the third PCM instance.

config_element.name: Pcm2ShortSyncEnable

config_element.name: Pcm3MasterMode
config_element.label: Enable PCM master mode for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the fourth PCM instance.

config_element.name: Pcm3ShortSyncEnable

config_element.name: Pcm3TxTristateEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: 0: drive PCM_OUT continuously. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in the last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is not active.

config_element.name: Pcm3TxTristateRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Enable Tx tristate rising edge for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only effective if Pcm3TxTristateEnable is set 0: tri-state PCM_OUT immediately after falling edge of PCM_CLK in last bit of an active slot, assuming the next slot is also not active. 1: tri-state PCM_OUT after rising edge of PCM_CLK after the last data bit of an active slot.

config_element.name: Pcm3SyncSuppressEnable
config_element.label: Suppress frame synchronisation for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Suppress PCM_SYNC on the fourth PCM instance while generating PCM_CLK (in master mode). Some codecs (connected to the PCM interface) use this to enter a low power state.

config_element.name: Pcm3GciModeEnable
config_element.label: Enable GCI mode for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Enable PCM GCI mode.

config_element.name: Pcm3MuteEnable
config_element.label: Mute PCM_DATA output for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Force PCM_DATA output on fourth PCM instance to be muted.

config_element.name: Pcm3LongLengthSyncEnable
config_element.label: Enable long length sync for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: If Pcm3ShortSyncEnable is not set, this key will configure PCM_SYNC pulse on fourth PCM instance to be 16 (long) or 8 (short) PCM_CLK cycles.

config_element.name: Pcm3SampleRisingEdgeEnable
config_element.label: Sample PCM_DATA on rising edge of PCM_CLK for fourth PCM instance

config_element.name: Pcm3SampleFormat
config_element.label: Sample format for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key is only provided for backward compatibility. Use Pcm3SampleSize to configure up to 24 bit format. If Pcm3SampleSize is set, this key is ignored. This key supports formats up to 16 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration.

config_element.name: Pcm3SlotCount
config_element.label: Number of slots in a PCM frame for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the number of PCM slots (1-4) that are to be present between sync pulses on the fourth digital interface. If the key Pcm3MasterClockRate is set, this key is ignored as a request has been made for a specific master clock frequency.

config_element.name: Pcm3SyncRate
config_element.label: The PCM_SYNC rate for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the fourth digital interface when operating as a master in PCM mode.

config_element.name: Pcm3AudioGain
config_element.label: Sample gain value for fourth PCM instance
config_element.description_user: Some Codecs allow their gain to be controlled by 3 extra bits received at the end of a 13-bit PCM sample. This key allows the value of those 3 bits to be specified for the fourth PCM instance.

config_element.name: I2s1SyncRate
config_element.label: Synchronisation rate in hertz for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the second digital interface when operating as a master in I2S mode.

config_element.name: I2s1MasterClockRate
config_element.label: Master clock rate in hertz for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the second digital interface in I2S mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate and bits per sample.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: I2s1MasterMode
config_element.label: Enable master mode on second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the second I2S instance.

config_element.name: I2s1JstfyFormat
config_element.label: Set sample justification for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: left justified, 1: right justified.

config_element.name: I2s1LftJstfyDly
config_element.label: Set delay before sampling when left justified for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: MSB of sample data occurs in the first bit clock period after sync transition. 1: MSB of sample data occurs in the second bit clock period after sync transition.

config_element.name: I2s1ChnlPlrty
config_element.label: I2S channel polarity for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: Sample data is left channel when sync clock line is high 1: Sample data is right channel when sync clock line is high

config_element.name: I2s1AudioAttenEnable
config_element.label: Enable attenuation on input data for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
Enables/disables the attenuation applied to incoming (into device) audio samples in case the I2s1BitsPerSample is set to 20 or 24 bits per sample on the second I2S instance.
false: 17 bit sample data is rounded down to 16 bits. true : the audio attenuation defined in the MIB key I2s1AudioAtten is applied over 24 bits with saturated rounding.
Requires I2s1CropEnable to be 0.

config_element.name: I2s1AudioAtten
config_element.label: Attenuation in 6 dB steps for second I2S instance

config_element.name: I2s1BitsPerSample
config_element.label: Bits per sample for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
This key specifies the number of bit clocks reserved for each (mono) sample on the second I2S interface. Valid settings are 16, 20, or 24 bits per sample.
This key does not specify how many of those bits are used for internal data processing; see I2s1SampleSize for that. If this key is set to a value larger than I2s1SampleSize, the additional bits are output as zeroes in the least significant bits. On the input, if sample size is 16 bits and bits-per-sample is greater, an attenuation can be applied, or samples larger than 16bit can be cropped to 16bits.
This key is also used to calculate the bit clock rate when in master mode and the I2s1MasterClockRate key is not set. (I2s1MasterClockRate takes precedence over this key for the purposes of supplying the master clock rate.) The calculation is bits per sample * 2 (channels) * sample rate.

config_element.name: I2s1CropEnable
config_element.label: Takes first 16bits after sync edge as sample for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
In this mode the most significant bits after sync are taken to be the sample data. If I2s1BitsPerSample is configured for 24/32 bits per sample, but I2s1SampleSize is configured for 16 bits per sample only, then crop enable decides whether the I2S interface rounds or truncates incoming 24/32 bits to 16 bits.
Additionally, it must be enabled if in 16 bit per sample mode when CLK rate = 32*sample rate.
0: Disable Cropping(or select rounding) 1: Enable Cropping
From CSRA681xx, the crop mode is selected automatically, and there is no need to set this key; it should be left at its default value.

config_element.name: I2s1TxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when TX begins for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S transmission begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S transmission begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2s1RxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when RX begins for second I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S reception begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S reception begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2s2SyncRate
config_element.label: Synchronisation rate in hertz for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the third digital interface when operating as a master in I2S mode.

config_element.name: I2s2MasterClockRate
config_element.label: Master clock rate in hertz for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the third digital interface in I2S mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate and bits per sample.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.name: I2s2MasterMode
config_element.label: Enable master mode on third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the third I2S instance.

config_element.name: I2s2JstfyFormat
config_element.label: Set sample justification for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: left justified, 1: right justified.

config_element.name: I2s2LftJstfyDly
config_element.label: Set delay before sampling when left justified for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: MSB of sample data occurs in the first bit clock period after sync transition. 1: MSB of sample data occurs in the second bit clock period after sync transition.

config_element.name: I2s2ChnlPlrty
config_element.label: I2S channel polarity for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: Sample data is left channel when sync clock line is high 1: Sample data is right channel when sync clock line is high

config_element.name: I2s2AudioAttenEnable
config_element.label: Enable attenuation on input data for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
Enables/disables the attenuation applied to incoming (into device) audio samples in case the I2s2BitsPerSample is set to 20 or 24 bits per sample on the third I2S instance.
false: 17 bit sample data is rounded down to 16 bits. true : the audio attenuation defined in the MIB key I2s2AudioAtten is applied over 24 bits with saturated rounding.
Requires I2s2CropEnable to be 0.

config_element.name: I2s2AudioAtten
config_element.label: Attenuation in 6 dB steps for third I2S instance

config_element.name: I2s2BitsPerSample
config_element.label: Bits per sample for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
This key specifies the number of bit clocks reserved for each (mono) sample on the third I2S interface. Valid settings are 16, 20, or 24 bits per sample.
This key does not specify how many of those bits are used for internal data processing; see I2s2SampleSize for that. If this key is set to a value larger than I2s2SampleSize, the additional bits are output as zeroes in the least significant bits. On the input, if sample size is 16 bits and bits-per-sample is greater, an attenuation can be applied, or samples larger than 16bit can be cropped to 16bits.
This key is also used to calculate the bit clock rate when in master mode and the I2s2MasterClockRate key is not set. (I2s2MasterClockRate takes precedence over this key for the purposes of supplying the master clock rate.) The calculation is bits per sample * 2 (channels) * sample rate.

config_element.name: I2s2CropEnable
config_element.label: Takes first 16bits after sync edge as sample for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
In this mode the most significant bits after sync are taken to be the sample data. If I2s2BitsPerSample is configured for 24/32 bits per sample, but I2s2SampleSize is configured for 16 bits per sample only, then crop enable decides whether the I2S interface rounds or truncates incoming 24/32 bits to 16 bits.
Additionally, it must be enabled if in 16 bit per sample mode when CLK rate = 32*sample rate.
0: Disable Cropping(or select rounding) 1: Enable Cropping
From CSRA681xx, the crop mode is selected automatically, and there is no need to set this key; it should be left at its default value.

config_element.name: I2s2TxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when TX begins for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S transmission begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S transmission begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2s2RxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when RX begins for third I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S reception begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S reception begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2s3SyncRate
config_element.label: Synchronisation rate in hertz for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sync rate in hertz for the fourth digital interface when operating as a master in I2S mode.

config_element.name: I2s3MasterClockRate
config_element.label: Master clock rate in hertz for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
When acting as a master on the fourth digital interface in I2S mode, this key allows the specification in hertz of the exact clock rate to be generated.
If set to zero, the firmware calculates the clock rate based on the sync rate and bits per sample.
Note: the name MasterClockRate is historical; this key pertains to the bit clock frequency, not the frequency of any MCLK signal in the system.

config_element.label: Enable master mode on fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: Setting the key to TRUE configures the hardware to generate the clock and sync signals on the fourth I2S instance.

config_element.name: I2s3JstfyFormat
config_element.label: Set sample justification for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: left justified, 1: right justified.

config_element.name: I2s3LftJstfyDly
config_element.label: Set delay before sampling when left justified for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: MSB of sample data occurs in the first bit clock period after sync transition. 1: MSB of sample data occurs in the second bit clock period after sync transition.

config_element.name: I2s3ChnlPlrty
config_element.label: I2S channel polarity for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: Sample data is left channel when sync clock line is high 1: Sample data is right channel when sync clock line is high

config_element.name: I2s3AudioAttenEnable
config_element.label: Enable attenuation on input data for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
Enables/disables the attenuation applied to incoming (into device) audio samples in case the I2s3BitsPerSample is set to 20 or 24 bits per sample on the fourth I2S instance.
false: 17 bit sample data is rounded down to 16 bits. true : the audio attenuation defined in the MIB key I2s3AudioAtten is applied over 24 bits with saturated rounding.
Requires I2s3CropEnable to be 0.

config_element.name: I2s3AudioAtten
config_element.label: Attenuation in 6 dB steps for fourth I2S instance

config_element.name: I2s3BitsPerSample
config_element.label: Bits per sample for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user:
This key specifies the number of bit clocks reserved for each (mono) sample on the fourth I2S interface. Valid settings are 16, 20, or 24 bits per sample.
This key does not specify how many of those bits are used for internal data processing; see I2s3SampleSize for that. If this key is set to a value larger than I2s3SampleSize, the additional bits are output as zeroes in the least significant bits. config_element.description_user:
In this mode the most significant bits after sync are taken to be the sample data. If I2s3BitsPerSample is configured for 24/32 bits per sample, but I2s3SampleSize is configured for 16 bits per sample only, then crop enable decides whether the I2S interface rounds or truncates incoming 24/32 bits to 16 bits.

0: Disable Cropping(or select rounding) 1: Enable Cropping
From CSRA681xx, the crop mode is selected automatically, and there is no need to set this key; it should be left at its default value.

config_element.name: I2s3TxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when TX begins for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S transmission begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S transmission begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: I2s3RxStartSample
config_element.label: Defines when RX begins for fourth I2S instance
config_element.description_user: 0: I2S reception begins during low sync clock phase. 1: I2S reception begins during high sync clock phase.

config_element.name: Spdif0OutPioConfig
config_element.label: Output PIO configuration for first SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how output pin for first SPDIF instance (instance 0) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif1OutPioConfig
config_element.label: Output PIO configuration for second SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how output pin for second SPDIF instance (instance 1) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif2OutPioConfig
config_element.label: Output PIO configuration for third SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how output pin for third SPDIF instance (instance 2) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: Spdif3OutPioConfig
config_element.label: Output PIO configuration for fourth SPDIF instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how output pin for fourth SPDIF instance (instance 3) is configured. The signal can be specified to use 0 - 95: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 255: Unused

config_element.name: DigMic0PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for first Digital Mic instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how pins for first Digital Mic instance (instance 0) are configured. The octet string key value contains a value each for the CLK_OUT & DATA_IN signal lines in that order. Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused If multiple digital mic instances share the same clock pin, set the CLK_OUT signal on any one of the instances to the required PIO number and set it to Unused on all the other instances. All digital mic channels that share a clock in this way must be placed in a sync group. Also, digital mic endpoints on the instance that defines CLK_OUT should be connected first for the clock to be enabled.

config_element.name: DigMic1PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for second Digital Mic instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how pins for second Digital Mic instance (instance 1) are configured. The octet string key value contains a value each for the CLK_OUT & DATA_IN signal lines in that order. Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused If multiple digital mic instances share the same clock pin, set the CLK_OUT signal on any one of the instances to the required PIO number and set it to Unused on all the other instances. All digital mic channels that share a clock in this way must be placed in a sync group. Also, digital mic endpoints on the instance that defines CLK_OUT should be connected first for the clock to be enabled.

config_element.name: DigMic2PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for third Digital Mic instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how pins for third Digital Mic instance (instance 2) are configured. The octet string key value contains a value each for the CLK_OUT & DATA_IN signal lines in that order. Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused If multiple digital mic instances share the same clock pin, set the CLK_OUT signal on any one of the instances to the required PIO number and set it to Unused on all the other instances. All digital mic channels that share a clock in this way must be placed in a sync group. Also, digital mic endpoints on the instance that defines CLK_OUT should be connected first for the clock to be enabled.

config_element.name: DigMic3PioConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration for fourth Digital Mic instance
config_element.description_user: This key defines how pins for fourth Digital Mic instance (instance 3) are configured. The octet string key value contains a value each for the CLK_OUT & DATA_IN signal lines in that order. Each signal can be specified to use 0x00 - 0x5F: PIO number or If the signal is not required, it should be set to 0xFF: Unused If multiple digital mic instances share the same clock pin, set the CLK_OUT signal on any one of the instances to the required PIO number and set it to Unused on all the other instances. All digital mic channels that share a clock in this way must be placed in a sync group. Also, digital mic endpoints on the instance that defines CLK_OUT should be connected first for the clock to be enabled.

config_element.name: PcmSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first PCM interface
config_element.description_user: This key supports formats up to 24 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration, 16: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 24: 24 bits in 24 cycle slot duration. If this key is set, it takes precedence over PcmSampleFormat.

config_element.name: Pcm1SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second PCM interface
config_element.description_user: This key supports formats up to 24 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration, 16: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 24: 24 bits in 24 cycle slot duration. If this key is set, it takes precedence over Pcm1SampleFormat.

config_element.name: Pcm2SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the third PCM interface
config_element.description_user: This key supports formats up to 24 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration, 16: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 24: 24 bits in 24 cycle slot duration. If this key is set, it takes precedence over Pcm2SampleFormat.

config_element.name: Pcm3SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the fourth PCM interface
config_element.description_user: This key supports formats up to 24 bit. 0: 13 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 1: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 2: 8 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 3: 8 bits in 8 cycle slot duration, 16: 16 bits in 16 cycle slot duration, 24: 24 bits in 24 cycle slot duration. If this key is set, it takes precedence over Pcm3SampleFormat.

config_element.name: I2sSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first I2S interface
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both input and output, and to both channels.

config_element.name: I2s1SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second I2S interface
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both input and output, and to both channels.

config_element.name: I2s2SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the third I2S interface
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both input and output, and to both channels.

config_element.name: I2s3SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the fourth I2S interface
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both input and output, and to both channels.

config_element.name: Codec0InputGain
config_element.label: Gain for the first codec input
config_element.description_user: Input gain in approximate 3dB steps, with 9 corresponding to 0dB, lower values to smaller gains (attenuation), and higher values to larger gains. Depending on the range of gains implemented in a device, settings at the lower and upper ends of the range may result in the same gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details. When Codec0RawInputGain is set, the value of this key is ignored.

config_element.name: Codec0RawInputGain
config_element.label: Low level gain control for the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The value for this key consists of bit fields for registers which control the codec input gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details of this setting. When a valid value for this key is defined, the value of Codec0InputGain is ignored.

config_element.name: Codec0InputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the first codec input
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the first codec input. Valid choices are: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 40000, 44100, and 48000.

config_element.name: Codec0InputDataSource
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the first codec input
config_element.description_user: ADC data source selection from: 0: output of the IIR Filter 1: output of the digital gain stage

config_element.name: Codec0InputRoute
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the first codec input
config_element.description_user: ADC chain routing: 0: IIR filter followed by Digital gain 1: Digital gain followed by IIR filter

config_element.name: Codec0InputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: Codec0InputG722FilterEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 filter in the first codec input
config_element.description_user: Enables optional G722 filter in the first codec input. Improves noise performance.

config_element.name: Codec0InputG722FirEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 FIR filter in the first codec input
config_element.description_user: Enable optional FIR filter in the G722 filter to droop the response slightly. This only has an effect if Codec0InputG722FilterEnable is also set.

config_element.name: Codec0InputTermination
config_element.label: Selects the analog inputs for the first codec input
config_element.description_user: This is a bitfield. When bit 15 is 0, the values of the lower bits correspond to the following standard configurations: 0: dual differential (LINEIN1_P:LINEIN1_N, LINEIN2_P:LINEIN2_N) 1: dual single-ended noninverted (LINEIN1_P, LINEIN2_P) 2: dual single-ended inverted (LINEIN1_N, LINEIN2_N) 3: single differential(MICIN1_P, MICIN2_N) When bit 15=1, the lower bits are a raw register value controlling the input line selection. Not all the configurations are valid on all devices and instances. See the device datasheet for details.

config_element.name: Codec0InputSidetoneSourceA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the first channel of the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec0InputSidetoneSourceB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the second channel of the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec0InputSidetoneGainA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the first channel of the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: Codec0InputSidetoneGainB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the second channel of the first codec input
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputGain
config_element.label: Gain for the first codec output
config_element.description_user: Output gain in approximate 3dB steps, with 15 corresponding to 0dB, lower values to smaller gains (attenuation), and higher values to larger gains. Depending on the range of gains implemented in a device, settings towards the lower and upper ends of the range may result in the same gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details. When Codec0RawOutputGain is set, the value of this key will be ignored.

config_element.name: Codec0RawOutputGain
config_element.label: Low level gain control for the first codec output
config_element.description_user: The value for this key consists of bit fields for registers which control the codec output gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details of this setting. When a valid value for this key is set, Codec0OutputGain will be ignored.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the first codec output
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the first codec output. Supported sample rates are: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 40000, 44100, 48000 and 96000.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first codec output
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: Codec0OutputInterpFilterMode
config_element.label: Selects the codec output interpolation FIR filter.
config_element.description_user: Selects the codec output interpolation FIR filter: 0: default interpolation filter 1: short FIR for reduced latency requirements, but not as good stop band rejection 2: narrow FIR to meet G.722 requirements 3: reserved

config_element.name: Codec0OutputIndividualSidetoneEnableA
config_element.label: Enables adding sidetone to the first channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: Source channels also have to be selected using Codec0OutputSourceMaskA.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputIndividualSidetoneEnableB
config_element.label: Enables adding sidetone to the second channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: Source channels also have to be selected using Codec0OutputSourceMaskB.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneSourceMaskA
config_element.label: Enables sidetone source channels for output on the first channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: This is a bitmask of 8 bits, one for each source channel. A maximum of two bits can be set at the same time.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneSourceMaskB
config_element.label: Enables sidetone source channels for output on the second channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: This is a bitmask of 8 bits, one for each source channel. A maximum of two bits can be set at the same time.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneInjectionPointA
config_element.label: Configures routing of the sidetone to the first channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Side tone is added after the digital gain. 1: Side tone is added before the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneInjectionPointB
config_element.label: Configures routing of the sidetone to the second channel of the first codec output
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Side tone is added after the digital gain. 1: Side tone is added before the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneInvertA
config_element.label: Inverts the sidetone phase on the first channel of the first codec output

config_element.name: Codec0OutputSidetoneInvertB
config_element.label: Inverts the sidetone phase on the second channel of the first codec output

config_element.name: Codec1InputGain
config_element.label: Gain for the second codec input
config_element.description_user: Input gain in approximate 3dB steps, with 9 corresponding to 0dB, lower values to smaller gains (attenuation), and higher values to larger gains. Depending on the range of gains implemented in a device, settings at the lower and upper ends of the range may result in the same gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details. When Codec1RawInputGain is set, the value of this key is ignored.

config_element.name: Codec1RawInputGain
config_element.label: Low level gain control for the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The value for this key consists of bit fields for registers which control the codec input gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details of this setting. When a valid value for this key is defined, the value of Codec1InputGain is ignored.

config_element.name: Codec1InputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the second codec input
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the second codec input. Valid choices are: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 40000, 44100, and 48000.

config_element.name: Codec1InputDataSource
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the second codec input
config_element.description_user: ADC data source selection from: 0: output of the IIR Filter 1: output of the digital gain stage

config_element.name: Codec1InputRoute
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the second codec input
config_element.description_user: ADC chain routing: 0: IIR filter followed by Digital gain 1: Digital gain followed by IIR filter

config_element.name: Codec1InputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: Codec1InputG722FilterEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 filter in the second codec input
config_element.description_user: Enables optional G722 filter in the second codec input. Improves noise performance.

config_element.name: Codec1InputG722FirEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 FIR filter in the second codec input
config_element.description_user: Enable optional FIR filter in the G722 filter to droop the response slightly. This only has an effect if Codec1InputG722FilterEnable is also set.

config_element.name: Codec1InputTermination
config_element.label: Selects the analog inputs for the second codec input
config_element.description_user: This is a bitfield. When bit 15 is 0, the values of the lower bits correspond to the following standard configurations: 0: dual differential (LINEIN1_P:LINEIN1_N, LINEIN2_P:LINEIN2_N) 1: dual single-ended noninverted (LINEIN1_P, LINEIN2_P OR MICIN1, MICIN2) 2: dual single-ended inverted (LINEIN1_N, LINEIN2_N) 3: single differential(MICIN1_P, MICIN2_N) When bit 15=1, the lower bits are a raw register value controlling the input line selection. Not all the configurations are valid on all devices and instances. See the device datasheet for details.

config_element.name: Codec1InputSidetoneSourceA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the first channel of the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec1InputSidetoneSourceB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the second channel of the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec1InputSidetoneGainA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the first channel of the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: Codec1InputSidetoneGainB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the second channel of the second codec input
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputGain
config_element.label: Gain for the second codec output
config_element.description_user: Output gain in approximate 3dB steps, with 15 corresponding to 0dB, lower values to smaller gains (attenuation), and higher values to larger gains. Depending on the range of gains implemented in a device, settings towards the lower and upper ends of the range may result in the same gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details. When Codec1RawOutputGain is set, the value of this key will be ignored.

config_element.name: Codec1RawOutputGain
config_element.label: Low level gain control for the second codec output
config_element.description_user: The value for this key consists of bit fields for registers which control the codec output gain. Refer to the device datasheet for details of this setting. When a valid value for this key is set, Codec1OutputGain will be ignored.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the second codec output
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the second codec output. Supported sample rates are: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 40000, 44100, 48000 and 96000.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputGainBoostEnable
config_element.label: Enables a 3dB gain boost for the second codec output
config_element.description_user: Enables a 3dB gain boost for the second codec output

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second codec output
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: Codec1OutputInterpFilterMode
config_element.label: Selects the codec output interpolation FIR filter.
config_element.description_user: Selects the codec output interpolation FIR filter: 0: default interpolation filter 1: short FIR for reduced latency requirements, but not as good stop band rejection 2: narrow FIR to meet G.722 requirements 3: reserved

config_element.name: Codec1OutputIndividualSidetoneEnableA
config_element.label: Enables adding sidetone to the first channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: Source channels also have to be selected using Codec0OutputSourceMaskA.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputIndividualSidetoneEnableB
config_element.label: Enables adding sidetone to the second channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: Source channels also have to be selected using Codec0OutputSourceMaskB.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneSourceMaskA
config_element.label: Enables sidetone source channels for output on the first channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: This is a bitmask of 8 bits, one for each source channel. A maximum of two bits can be set at the same time.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneSourceMaskB
config_element.label: Enables sidetone source channels for output on the second channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: This is a bitmask of 8 bits, one for each source channel. A maximum of two bits can be set at the same time.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneInjectionPointA
config_element.label: Configures routing of the sidetone to the first channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Side tone is added after the digital gain. 1: Side tone is added before the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneInjectionPointB
config_element.label: Configures routing of the sidetone to the second channel of the second codec output
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Side tone is added after the digital gain. 1: Side tone is added before the digital gain.

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneInvertA
config_element.label: Inverts the sidetone phase on the first channel of the second codec output

config_element.name: Codec1OutputSidetoneInvertB
config_element.label: Inverts the sidetone phase on the second channel of the second codec output

config_element.name: Codec1OutputDrive
config_element.label: Drive current for the headphone/speaker output of the second codec
config_element.description_user: There are two valid choices: 0: 16 Ohm 1: 32 Ohm (default) The setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: SidetoneGain
config_element.label: Global sidetone gain default
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. This key sets the default for all sidetone input devices i.e. codec ADCs and digital mics. Override it with the following keys in order to configure different gains for input devices: Codec0InputSidetoneGainA Codec0InputSidetoneGainB Codec1InputSidetoneGainA Codec2InputSidetoneGainB DigMic0SidetoneGainA DigMic0SidetoneGainB DigMic1SidetoneGainA DigMic1SidetoneGainB DigMic2SidetoneGainA DigMic2SidetoneGainB DigMic3SidetoneGainA DigMic3SidetoneGainB

config_element.name: CodecSidetoneEnable
config_element.label: Global sidetone output enable for both codec instances
config_element.description_user: This flag enables sidetone overall for both codec instances. In addition to this flag, the individual sidetone enable and sidetone source mask for each codec output channel have to be set to enable sidetone.

config_element.name: CodecOutputDisableTimeout
config_element.label: Delay for turning off codec output hardware
config_element.description_user: To reduce pops and clicks during fast close/open sequences of codec devices, this setting allows delaying part of the deactivation of the output hardware. The interval is specified in microseconds.

config_element.name: DigMic0InputRate
config_element.label: Sample rate in Hz for the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the first digital microphone. Valid choices are: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 40000, 44100, and 48000.

config_element.name: DigMic0InputGain
config_element.label: Input gain for the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user:
This is a bitfield value. If bit 15 is cleared, the lower 4 bits contain a gain in 2's complement format, zero representing unity gain, and roughly 3dB steps. I.e. the approximate gains for each value between 0x0000 and 0x000F are: 0x0007: 21dB 0x0006: 18dB 0x0005: 15dB 0x0004: 12dB 0x0003: 9dB 0x0002: 6dB 0x0001: 3dB 0x0000: 0dB 0x000F: -3dB 0x000E: -6dB 0x000D: -9dB 0x000C: -12dB 0x000B: -15dB 0x000A: -18dB 0x0009: -21dB 0x0008: -24dB
If bit 15 is set, the lower 9 bits represent a linear gain scale in steps of 1/32, i.e. from 0x8000 = mute, 0x8001 = approx. -30dB, to 0x81FF = approx. 24dB.

config_element.name: DigMic0ChanSwap
config_element.label: Swap the two channels of the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: If set, the two channels of the first digital microphone are swapped, i.e. the bit clock is inverted.

config_element.name: DigMic0ClockRate
config_element.label: Configures the clock rate for the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The value represents the clock rate in kHz. The supported values and resulting clock rates are: 500: 500kHz 1000: 1MHz 2000: 2MHz 4000: 4MHz

config_element.name: DigMic0AmpSel
config_element.label: Configures the input levels for the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Valid choices are: 0x0700, 0x0601, 0x0502, 0x0403.

config_element.name: DigMic0SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: DigMic0DataSource
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: ADC data source selection from: 0: output of the IIR Filter 1: output of the digital gain stage

config_element.name: DigMic0Route
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: ADC chain routing: 0: IIR filter followed by Digital gain 1: Digital gain followed by IIR filter

config_element.name: DigMic0G722FilterEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 filter in the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Enables optional G722 filter in the first digital microphone. Improves noise performance.

config_element.name: DigMic0G722FirEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 FIR filter in the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Enable optional FIR filter in the G722 filter to droop the response slightly. This only has an effect if Codec0InputG722FilterEnable is also set.

config_element.name: DigMic0SidetoneSourceA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the first channel of the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: DigMic0SidetoneSourceB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the second channel of the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: DigMic0SidetoneGainA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the first channel of the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the second channel of the first digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.
