config_element.name: DigMic3AmpSel
config_element.label: Configures the input levels for the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Valid choices are: 0x0700, 0x0601, 0x0502, 0x0403.

config_element.name: DigMic3SampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The sample size for processing is either 16 or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit

config_element.name: DigMic3DataSource
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: ADC data source selection from: 0: output of the IIR Filter 1: output of the digital gain stage

config_element.name: DigMic3Route
config_element.label: Configures the signal routing within the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: ADC chain routing: 0: IIR filter followed by Digital gain 1: Digital gain followed by IIR filter

config_element.name: DigMic3G722FilterEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 filter in the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Enables optional G722 filter in the fourth digital microphone. Improves noise performance.

config_element.name: DigMic3G722FirEnable
config_element.label: Enables optional G722 FIR filter in the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: Enable optional FIR filter in the G722 filter to droop the response slightly. This only has an effect if Codec0InputG722FilterEnable is also set.

config_element.name: DigMic3SidetoneSourceA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the first channel of the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: DigMic3SidetoneSourceB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone source point for the second channel of the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The valid choices are: 0: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the ADC IIR filter (default), 1: Sidetone signal is taken from the output of the digital gain.

config_element.name: DigMic3SidetoneGainA
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the first channel of the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: DigMic3SidetoneGainB
config_element.label: Configures the sidetone gain for the second channel of the fourth digital microphone
config_element.description_user: The gain is specified as an unsigned 4-bit value, with approximate 3dB steps, and unity gain for a value of 11. I.e. the range is approximately -33dB to +12dB. If this key is not set, the gain is taken from the key SidetoneGain.

config_element.name: Spdif0InputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first SPDIF input
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: Spdif0ReceiveAccuracy
config_element.label: Selects the receive frequency accuracy threshold for the first SPDIF input
config_element.description_user: 0: Low accuracy (approx. 1%) 1: High accuracy (approx. 0.4%)

config_element.name: Spdif0OutputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the first SPDIF output
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the first SPDIF output instance. Supported sample rates are: 22050, 24000, 32000, 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000. This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: Spdif0OutputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the first SPDIF output
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: Spdif1InputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second SPDIF input
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: Spdif1ReceiveAccuracy
config_element.label: Selects the receive frequency accuracy threshold for the second SPDIF input
config_element.description_user: 0: Low accuracy (approx. 1%) 1: High accuracy (approx. 0.4%)

config_element.name: Spdif1OutputRate
config_element.label: The sample rate in Hz for the second SPDIF output
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the sample rate in hertz for the second SPDIF output instance. Supported sample rates are: 22050, 24000, 32000, 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000. This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: Spdif1OutputSampleSize
config_element.label: Sample size for the second SPDIF output
config_element.description_user: The sample size is either 16 bits or 24 bits. 16: 16 bit 24: 24 bit This setting applies to both channels.

config_element.name: RemoteWdPingTimeout
config_element.label: Watchdog timeout multiplier for pinging secondary processor.
config_element.description_user: Defines the period (in terms of multiples of Curator watchdog pings) during which 0 will wait for a response from secondary processor. Value 0 is intended for debugging purposes and causes 0 to report success regardless of status of the secondary processor.

config_element.name: EnablePxTimer
config_element.label: Flag for enabling/disabling Px start/stop timer.
config_element.description_user: A timer is run to determine whether starting/stopping Px is successful or not. This flag disables it for debugging purposes.

config_element.name: HeapAllocation
config_element.label: Sizes of the heaps for each processor
config_element.description_user: This key allows partitioning the memory available for heaps between the processor cores. The value is an array of 6 octets, each octet represents the size of a heap partition in kilobytes. Note octet string values are in hex. octet 0: heap 1 for 0, octet 1: heap 2 for 0, octet 2: heap 3 for 0, octet 3: heap 1 for P1, octet 4: heap 2 for P1, octet 5: heap 3 for P1. For CSRA68100, CSRA68105: heap 1 for 0 uses slow memory accessible through DM1 heap 2 for 0 uses fast memory accessible through DM2 heap 3 for 0 uses fast memory accessible through DM1 heap 1 for P1 uses slow memory accessible through DM1 heap 2 for P1 uses fast memory accessible through DM2 heap 3 for P1 uses fast memory accessible through DM1 For QCC302x, QCA669x, and QCC512x: heap 1 for 0 uses memory accessible through DM1 heap 2 for 0 uses memory accessible through DM2 heap 3 for 0 is unused. Set to 0. heap 1 for P1 uses memory accessible through DM1 heap 2 for P1 uses memory accessible through DM2 heap 3 for P1 is unused. Set to 0. For QCC304x, and QCC514x: heap 1 for 0 uses. heap 2 for 0 is unused. Set to 0. heap 3 for 0 is unused. Set to 0. heap 1 for P1 uses. heap 2 for P1 is unused. Set to 0. heap 3 for P1 is unused. Set to 0.

config_element.name: ProfilerEnable
config_element.label: Enable the built-in profiler
config_element.description_user:
The audio subsystem software has a built-in profiler, which accounts processor time consumption to individual operators and other tasks. The profiler data can be read with a variety of debugging facilities.
This key enables this profiler. It is disabled by default, as the profiler itself can consume a significant amount of processor time.

config_element.name: MclkInvert
config_element.label: Invert MCLK signal to change MCLK vs PCM/I2S phase alignment
config_element.description_user:
This key allows the phase relationship between the MCLK signal and other signals of I2S/PCM interfaces (bit-clock etc) to be adjusted.
It can be used with a generated MCLK output (but only if that output uses dedicated routing, i.e., 0xFE in the third element of Pcm*PioConfig) or an MCLK input signal.
If set, any MCLK output does not change, but an inverted version of the MCLK signal is used internally by the device (for all PCM/I2S interfaces), with the net effect that the other interface signals are delayed by half an MCLK cycle relative to the MCLK signal.
(If an MCLK signal is output as part of an interface using PIO routing -- numbers other than 0xFE in Pcm*PioConfig -- this key cannot be used to effect a phase adjustment between the MCLK and other outputs. In this case the only effect will be to invert the MCLK output, which will only be observable if the MCLK signal does not have a 50/50 mark/space ratio.)

config_element.name: USBSourceBufferSize
config_element.label: Configures the USB source endpoint output buffer size (in words)
config_element.description_user: The output buffer of USB source endpoint needs to be large enough to not fill up during the longest period the connected operator may be blocked. The worst case for this is the sum of the run times for all the other operators in the system. The required buffering is then duration (s) * sample rate (Hz) * channels.

config_element.name: DefaultLogLevel
config_element.label: Configures the default audio subsystem log level
config_element.description_user: The audio subsystem logging provided in Pydbg or ACAT can be adjusted to show more or less verbose information. Although this can be configured at run time, early messages may be not be shown unless a higher default level is configured.

config_element.name: Codec0UseClassABAmplifier
config_element.label: Connect the DAC to a class AB amplifier instead of a class D amplifier
config_element.description_user: When this key is set to true, the audio DACs are connected to a class AB amplifier instead of a class D amplifier. The use of a class D amplifier is recommended in headphone applications while the use of a class AB amplifier is recommended for line output. The line can then be connected to another amplifier capable of driving the speakers used in a sound bar application.

config_element.name: PreferredROMOwner
config_element.label: Select the preferential owner of the audio ROM.
config_element.description_user: This key selects which of the audio cpus is the preferential owner of the audio ROM.

config_element.name: HeapOverflowToFreeRAM
config_element.label: Heap overflow to free ram configuration
config_element.description_user: Enable this to enable the heap memory to overflow to the free ram

config_element.name: AudioEndpointKickPeriod
config_element.label: Audio endpoint default kick period, in microseconds
config_element.description_user: This key changes the default time period for running audio processing. Larger values typically result in lower overall MIPS (and hence power) but will use more data RAM. This setting does not apply to HFP graphs using the AEC reference operator, or to any other overridden endpoints.

config_element.name: USBSinkOutputBufferSize
config_element.label: Configures the To Host USB (USB Tx) output buffer size in octets
config_element.description_user:
This key configures the size of the output buffer for USB Sink (to Host) endpoint, the size will be rounded up to nearest power of two value. The buffer needs to be able to contain sufficient number of audio packets to cover jitter in the system. The required buffer size varies depending on the largest sample rate, channels and the frame size that are going to be supported. Use the production of the following four terms to configure the buffer size::
-maximum number of packets: default and minimum is 3 but can be set using USBSinkMaxPacketsInOutputBuffer MIB key -channels: maximum number of channels to be supported (2 for stereo) -subframe_size: number of octets in each audio sub frame (3 for 24-bit support) -max packet len in frames: use (max_sample_rate/1000 + 1)

config_element.name: USBSourceInputBufferSize
config_element.label: Configures the From Host USB (USB Rx) input buffer size in octets
config_element.description_user:
This key configures the size of the input buffer for USB Source (from Host) endpoint, the size will be rounded up to nearest power of two value. The input buffer needs to be able to contain at least 2 audio packets to cover jitter in the system. The required buffer size varies depending on the largest sample rate, channels and the frame size that are going to be supported. Use the production of the following terms to configure the buffer size:terms:
maximum number of packets: use 2 channels: maximum number of channels to be supported (2 for stereo) subframe_size: number of octets in each audio sub frame (3 for 24-bit support) max packet len in frames: use (max_sample_rate/1000 + 1)

config_element.name: USBSinkInputBufferSize
config_element.label: Configures the USB sink endpoint input buffer size (in words)
config_element.description_user: The input buffer of USB sink endpoint needs to be large enough to not fill up during the period that endpoint cannot send packets because its output buffer has the maximum number of packets. This situation can happen if the reader of output buffer (apps normally) is in busy time. Set this to a value corresponding to twice of USB audio packets configured by USBSinkMaxPacketsInOutputBuffer MIB key.

config_element.name: USBSinkMaxPacketsInOutputBuffer
config_element.label: Configures maximum number of packets in the USB to host output buffer
config_element.description_user: To control the to host latency, the USB sink endpoint will keep the maximum number of buffered packets in the output buffer at a certain number. The output buffer size MUST be big enough to be able to contain this number of packets.

config_element.name: AoVDutyCycleParameters
config_element.label: Duty cycle configuration when running AoV in low power mode
config_element.description_user: This key defines the parameters for calculating the duty cycle when running Always on Voice with Wake on Voice in low power mode. The octet string key value contains a value each for the total time (period) of the pulse width (specified in 10s of milliseconds) and duty cycle in percentage. Default is 30ms duty cycle every 100ms. Set both values to zero to turn OFF duty cycle mode.

config_element.name: MclkSourceType
config_element.label: Source for the MCLK
config_element.description_user: This key defines whether an external clock is used for the MCLK (or it is generated internally). Default internal.

config_element.name: MclkExtFreq
config_element.label: External MCLK frequency
config_element.description_user: This key defines the frequency in Hz of the external clock used as MCLK. It is ignored if MclkSourceType is not "external". Value 0 means "measure on use" (default)

config_element.name: PcmClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the PCM clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for PCM. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm1ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the PCM1 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for PCM1. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK 2: BORROW_PCM0 3: BORROW_EPCM0 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm2ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the PCM2 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for PCM2. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK 2: BORROW_PCM0 3: BORROW_EPCM0 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm3ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the PCM3 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for PCM3. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2sClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the I2S clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for I2S. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s1ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the I2S1 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for I2S1. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK 2: BORROW_PCM0 3: BORROW_EPCM0 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s2ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the I2S2 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for I2S2. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK 2: BORROW_PCM0 3: BORROW_EPCM0 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s3ClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the I2S3 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used for I2S3. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Spdif0OutputClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the Spdif0 out clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used as out clock in SPDIF0. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Spdif1OutputClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the Spdif0 out clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used as out clock in SPDIF1. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Spdif2OutputClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the Spdif2 out clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used as out clock in SPDIF2. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Spdif3OutputClkSource
config_element.label: Source of the Spdif3 out clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the clock used as out clock in SPDIF3. Values are: 0: SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK 1: MCLK Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: PcmMclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for PCM clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for PCM clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm1MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for PCM1 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for PCM1 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm2MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for PCM2 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for PCM2 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: Pcm3MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for PCM3 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for PCM3 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2sMclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for I2S clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for I2S clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s1MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for I2S1 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for I2S1 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s2MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for I2S2 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for I2S2 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: I2s3MclkMult
config_element.label: Mclk scaling factor for I2S3 clock.
config_element.description_user: This key defines the scaling factor between MCLK and sync rate for I2S3 clock. Values are: 128: ratio 128 256: ratio 256 384: ratio 384 Default value is SYSTEM_ROOT_CLK.

config_element.name: P1PMHeapAllocation
config_element.label: Number of banks of PM RAM to be allocated for P1 to use as PM heap
config_element.description_user: This key can be used to configure the number of banks of PM RAM to be allocated for Processor Core 1 to use as PM heap. The total number of banks available and bank size (in kilobytes) depends on the chip. For CSRA68100: There are 7 banks, each 16kB For QCC340x and QCA669x: There are 8 banks, each 8kB For QCC514x: There are 14 banks, each 8kB P1 can be set up to have no PM heap, provided P1 is not required to process downloadable capabilities. Actual P1 PM heap size will also depend on the product

config_element.name: DigiMic0WarmUpDuration
config_element.label: Add duration in milliseconds for taking care of digital mic warm up time
config_element.description_user: This key can be used to set a duration in milliseconds until then digital mic instance_0 data will be forcefully muted.

config_element.name: DigiMic1WarmUpDuration
config_element.label: Add duration in milliseconds for taking care of digital mic warm up time
config_element.description_user: This key can be used to set a duration in milliseconds until then digital mic instance_1 data will be forcefully muted.

config_element.name: DigiMic2WarmUpDuration
config_element.label: Add duration in milliseconds for taking care of digital mic warm up time
config_element.description_user: This key can be used to set a duration in milliseconds until then digital mic instance_2 data will be forcefully muted.

config_element.name: DigiMic3WarmUpDuration
config_element.label: Add duration in milliseconds for taking care of digital mic warm up time
config_element.description_user: This key can be used to set a duration in milliseconds until then digital mic instance_3 data will be forcefully muted.

config_element.name: LogACCMDmsg
config_element.label: Log ACCMD messages
config_element.description_user: Setting this key to TRUE configures the ACCMD to log the incoming and the outgoing messages to the debug log buffer.

config_element.name: Codec0OutAmpQualityMode
config_element.label: Configure DAC for best THD using very high output power.
config_element.description_user: To obtain the best THD with the very highest audio power output, this MIB should be set to TRUE. This need only be set when the application run the D-class or AB-Class amplifiers at or near full-scale.

config_element.name: AncEnableDelay
config_element.label: Enable delay for ANC
config_element.description_user: Delay required in milliseconds after enabling the codec output while enabling ANC to reduce pops and clicks.

config_element.name: AncRampUpTime
config_element.label: Gain ramp up delay for ANC enable
config_element.description_user: Time in milliseconds for ramping up the ANC gain after enabling ANC to reduce pops and clicks at the output.

config_element.name: HeapAllocationSram
config_element.label: Sizes of the heaps for the external SRAM
config_element.description_user: This key allows partitioning the memory available for the external heaps between the processor cores. The value is an array of 6 octets, each pair of octets represents the size in KB( e.g: 256KB is represented as 01 00). octet 0 and 1: Size of external SRAM, octet 2 and 3: Data heap size for 0, octet 4 and 5: Data heap size for P1, octet 6 and 7: reserved, octet 8 and 9: reserved, octet 10 and 11: reserved, octet 12 and 13: reserved,

config_element.name: AudioThreadOffload
config_element.label: Enable thread offload
config_element.description_user: Enable thread offload
config_element.description_internal: Configuring this key to 'true', when dual core support is not enabled (CoreEnable = [00]), enables certain capabilities to offload work onto the second core ("thread offload").

config_element.name: RelaxMallocStrictness
config_element.label: Relax strictness in memory allocation preference
config_element.description_user:
In use cases that are memory intensive, this key can be set to one of four possible values to allow the malloc algorithm to try another preference (eg: MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM1 instead of MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM2) or another allocation method rather than failing the allocation totally. Possible values: 0: Default. Memory allocation mechanism attempts to allocate evenly between DM1 and DM2 (called load balancing) for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_NONE. No fallback for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM1 and MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM2. 1: Load balancing enabled for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_NONE. Failure to allocate from the requested region for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM1 or MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM2 will fallback to the other region. 2: DM1 as the preferred region for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_NONE option with no load balancing. Failure to allocate from the requested region for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM1 or MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM2 will fallback to the other region. 3: DM2 as the preferred region for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_NONE option with no load balancing. Failure to allocate from the requested region for MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM1 or MALLOC_PREFERENCE_DM2 will fallback to the other region. Please note this may have an impact on performance.
A non-zero PreferredSharedMallocThreshold key overrides this key for sizes below than the specified value if free memory is available in the shared heap.

config_element.name: Codec0OutClsDAmpDitherEnable
config_element.label: Enable Dither on Codec 0 output
config_element.description_user: Setting this MIB key whitens any tonal noise in the audio band with a small SNR degradation. This MIB is applicable only for Class D Closed loop mode.

config_element.name: Codec0OutClsDAmpControlMode
config_element.label: Enable Codec 0 output Amplifier control mode
config_element.description_user: To reduce the pop/clicks while turning on Class D DAC, this MIB should be set to true. Setting the MIB key to true may result in a small increase in power consumption. This MIB is applicable only for Class D closed loop mode.

config_element.name: DDSClockSource
config_element.label: Configures the DDS clock source.
config_element.description_user: This mib key is used in order to configure the DDS clock source and frequency. Accepted values are: 0 : DDS clock will be running from SPLL at 80 MHz 1 : DDS will be running from XTAL clock at 32 MHz X : Future use.

config_element.name: PreferredSharedMallocRanges
config_element.label: Configures the threshold for allocating memory from the shared heap
config_element.description_user:
This key provides an option to allocate memory from the shared heap as the first preference if the malloc preference is set to MALLOC_PREFERENCE_NONE and the requested size falls within the specified range.
The key must specify 3 different size ranges in the ascending order as lower size range start, lower size range end, middle size range start, middle size range end, higher size range start and higher size range end.
